emergence.util

Class ActionTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • emergence.util.ActionTimer

  • public class ActionTimer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the timing of the actions. Every possible controller is going to have a loop based algorithm. To make sure that we are not longer calculating as 40 milliseconds this timer helps by stopping the average time of the iteration.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addIteration() 
      double getRemaining() 
      boolean isTimeLeft()
      Checks if there is enough time left for the next iteration by looking at the average of all last iteration and by using a safety time limit.
      java.lang.String status()
      Create a String with information that are relevant for the action timing.

      • ActionTimer

        public ActionTimer(ElapsedCpuTimer cpuTimer)
        This is the constructor for the Timer object. The elapsedTimer that is given to the act method of the controller is needed to get the remaining time. First all variable are set by using the reset() method.

      • isTimeLeft

        public boolean isTimeLeft()
        Checks if there is enough time left for the next iteration by looking at the average of all last iteration and by using a safety time limit.

        if there is enough time for a further iteration.
